headline: TikTok Deal Has China’s Blessing, Trump Says After Xi Call
summary: “I had a great call with President Xi and as you know, and approved the TikTok deal, and we’re in the process,” Trump told reporters at the White House hours after speaking with the Chinese leader.  Both the US and China have indicated that more work needs to be done to iron out final differences on a proposal for Beijing-based ByteDance Ltd. to divest its majority stake in the video-sharing platform in the US.

headline: Nvidia explores $500 million investment in UK self-driving startup Wayve
summary: STORY: U.S. chip giant Nvidia could invest $500 million in Britain's Wayve.That's according to the autonomous driving tech group on Thursday.They said Nvidia signed a letter of intent for the possible investment in the next funding round.It comes after Britain and the U.S. signed a technology pact aimed at boosting ties in AI and other fields.Wayve was founded in 2017 and raised more than $1 billion last year.Its autonomous driving platforms have been powered by a partnership with Nvidia, whose chips are now a major part of a global AI boom.Japan's Softbank and ride-hailing platform Uber also made a separate investment in the firm last year.Wayve's technology uses machine learning with camera sensors mounted on the vehicles to learn from traffic patterns and driver behavior.That's different to conventional systems that rely on detailed digital maps and coding.Wayve currently operates in Britain and the U.S. and expanded testing and development to wider markets like Germany and Japan.Nvidia also pledged $2.70 billion in investments in the British AI startup ecosystem on Thursday.

raw.headline: Nvidia explores $500 million investment in UK self-driving startup Wayve
raw.summary: STORY: U.S. chip giant Nvidia could invest $500 million in Britain's Wayve.That's according to the autonomous driving tech group on Thursday.They said Nvidia signed a letter of intent for the possible investment in the next funding round.It comes after Britain and the U.S. signed a technology pact aimed at boosting ties in AI and other fields.Wayve was founded in 2017 and raised more than $1 billion last year.Its autonomous driving platforms have been powered by a partnership with Nvidia, whose chips are now a major part of a global AI boom.Japan's Softbank and ride-hailing platform Uber also made a separate investment in the firm last year.Wayve's technology uses machine learning with camera sensors mounted on the vehicles to learn from traffic patterns and driver behavior.That's different to conventional systems that rely on detailed digital maps and coding.Wayve currently operates in Britain and the U.S. and expanded testing and development to wider markets like Germany and Japan.Nvidia also pledged $2.70 billion in investments in the British AI startup ecosystem on Thursday.

headline: Intel, Fedex, Cardlytics, Brera, : Trending Stocks
summary: Intel (INTC) skyrocketed yesterday, closing more than 22% higher after Nvidia (NVDA) announced its $5 billion investment in the company, as part of a push to produce more AI hardware and products in the US. Fedex (FDX) is in focus after reporting results late yesterday that beat analysts’ expectations despite tariff headwinds, and we take a look at a tiny company that has become the market’s latest rocket ship: Brera Holdings (BREA). Plus, Cardlytics (CDLX) soars on hopes that it will benefit from American Express' (AXP) new Platinum cards. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Trump, Xi Call Underway as They Aim to Finalize TikTok Deal
summary: The leaders are expected to discuss a framework agreement unveiled this week to shift control of TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd. to a consortium of American investors.  Details of the deal haven’t been announced, and Trump remained noncommittal in an interview with Fox News that aired Thursday, signaling that a lot rides on how Xi responds.  “It sounds like they’ve approved TikTok, and TikTok is a tremendous amount of money for the United States so that was nice, but we’ll see how that all works,” Trump said.

raw.headline: Trump, Xi Call Underway as They Aim to Finalize TikTok Deal
raw.summary: The leaders are expected to discuss a framework agreement unveiled this week to shift control of TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd. to a consortium of American investors.  Details of the deal haven’t been announced, and Trump remained noncommittal in an interview with Fox News that aired Thursday, signaling that a lot rides on how Xi responds.  “It sounds like they’ve approved TikTok, and TikTok is a tremendous amount of money for the United States so that was nice, but we’ll see how that all works,” Trump said.
